alert.note: Alert for Central Laramie County; Central Laramie Range and Southwest Platte County; East Platte County; Goshen County (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 22 at 5:18AM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southern Goshen, north central Laramie and eastern Platte Counties through 545 AM MDT... At 518 AM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Bordeaux to 11 miles northeast of Whitaker. Movement was north at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Wheatland, Guernsey, Fort Laramie, Chugwater, Yoder, Chugcreek, Lakeview North, Bordeaux, Westview Circle, Y-O Ranch, Hawk Springs, Hawk Springs Campground, Fort Laramie National Historic Site, Slater, Hawk Springs Recreation Area, Grayrocks Reservoir, Guernsey Campground, Veteran and Hartville. This includes Interstate 25 in Wyoming between mile markers 42 and 88. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Central Laramie County; Central Laramie Range and Southwest Platte County; East Platte County; Goshen County
